sen.j: 対策を経て、内記・文章博士などを歴任し、その後、従四位上式部省に至った。
sen.e: Through Taisaku (one of the examinations for adopting government officials under the Ritsuryo legal codes), he successively worked in different positions including naiki (secretary of the Ministry of Central Affairs) and Monjo hakase (professor of literature), and later he moved up to Jushiijnojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Ceremonial)

After passing the Taisaku (an examination for adopting government officials under the Ritsuryo legal codes), Arimasa consecutively worked in different positions, including Naiki (Secretary of the Ministry of Central Affairs) and Monjo hakase (professor of literature), later reaching the rank of Jushiijnojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) with a post in the Shikibu-sho (the Ministry of Ceremonial).

sen.j: 醍醐天皇・村上天皇朝に活躍し、憲平親王（冷泉天皇）の侍読を勤めた。
sen.e: He was active in the eras of Emperor Daigo and Emperor Murakami, and he served as Jidoku (imperial tutor) for Imperial Prince Norihira (Emperor Reizei).
